text: Isabella Banks Markell (1891–1980) was an American painter.https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/427086 Markell was born in Superior, Wisconsin. She studied at the Ecole de Beaux-Arts in the 1930s. MArkell was known in particular for her many landscape paintings of New York's East River. Her work is included in the collections of the Seattle Art Museum, Drury University and the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. ==References== Category:1891 births Category:1980 deaths Category:People from Superior, Wisconsin Category:Artists from Wisconsin Category:Alumni of the École des Beaux-Arts Category:20th-century American women artists
title: Isabella Banks Markell
